<JD_START>
Job Title: Aerospace Supervisor

Location: St Louis, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Maxar is seeking an Aerospace Supervisor to become a member of our Aerospace Terminals team in St. Louis, MO or Remote. As a valued team member, you will assist our customers in executing their worldwide mission with expert understanding and collection of their data.

Life with Us

Your Project: In this role, you will join a team of aeronautical professionals focused on producing and delivering quality data that exceed our customers' goals. As a member of the Aerospace leadership team you will have direct reports, be responsible for maintaining the budget and schedule, and still perform aerospace analyst duties.

Your Career: We are very serious about professional development and continuing education at Maxar. We offer our team members the opportunity to define their career trajectory. Our group has fantastic resources to support learning and development. You will work with your manager and/or a mentor to set goals and design a development plan to advance your career.

What We Offer: Time for dedicated professional development, conference attendance, corporate partner and industry training, peer group collaboration, hackathons, paid certifications, education reimbursement, and student loan forgiveness.

Responsibilities:

Demonstrate effective leadership and people management skills, including performance assessment, training, career development, and recognition/disciplinary actions for aeronautical team members. Effectively maintain production schedules and budgets, provide necessary document and reports, and be the POC for interactions with the customer. Duties include but are not limited to, converting worldwide aeronautical data into digital and graphic formats for use in flight operations in accordance with product specifications.

Analyze and evaluate aeronautical chart products and aeronautical information publications

Create and maintain digital procedure coding for terminal instrument flight procedures and aeronautical chart products

Maintain a good working knowledge of international aeronautical and flight procedure practices.

Ensure all production quality processes are followed at all times.

Coordinate with team to ensure any required data corrections or non-conformances are properly resolved

Contribute as a team member with the production and updating of aeronautical charts

Minimum Qualifications:

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Bachelor’s degree in aeronautical/aviation, GIS, or related field; or equivalent and relevant Aeronautical experience to include a Private Pilot’s license with an Instrument Rating, Air Traffic Controller or other related career fields.

Preferred Skills:

Previous management or leadership roles and/or responsibilities

Air navigation and aviation industry experience is desirable but not essential

Previous procedure plate creation or procedure coding is HIGHLY desirable

Experience in production or use of instrument approach procedures (IAP), standard instrument departures (SID), standard terminals arrival routes (STAR), and en-route charts.

Ability to perform QC review of other’s work to confirm compliance with specifications

Interest in the aviation industry a definite asset

Demonstrated computer proficiency

Strong time management, multi-tasking. and organizational skills

Effective communication skills (verbal and written)

Ability to perform a detail-oriented task

Ability to review source data and request clarification of source and specification issues as identified. Maxar Technologies values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
